content:
About Ogilvy 
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry.
 
About the Role 
The Senior Project Manager partners with relevant departments to deliver operational discipline and delivery excellence, speed to market, resource optimization, and profitability management to their business(es). They handle a wide range of assignments, projects, and/or clients with a high degree of success and independence. They take responsibility for the accounts they manage, demonstrate leadership skills, and have strong internal team relationships. The ideal candidate is passionate about finding strategic, creative solutions for our clients.
 
What You’ll Do

Interface regularly with all client levels on the strategy and process of delivery across integrated business(es)
Collaborate with internal agency teams and key external partners to ensure high level of creative output and adherence to production guidelines.
Grow and protect margins in conjunction with Account Management
Anticipate client needs, working with Group PMO to ensure accurate resource allocation and management for every project.
Draft and own project plans (i.e. timelines, budget, SOWs, staff plans) inclusive of Account Management, Strategy, Creative, Production, Media, and Measurement
Simplify complex processes and implement ways of working that maximize efficiency.
Conduct internal/external post-project analyses to identify patterns for replicating success, as well as identify ways to improve.
Effectively and impartially navigate teams with conflicting priorities.
Develop and maintain high levels of team trust, communication, collaboration, productivity, and engagement.

 
What You’ll Need 

7+ years’ experience managing integrated accounts and/or pitches at an advertising agency.
Experience with diverse client portfolios and team management on accounts generating $3M+ in revenue.
Experience managing traditional advertising campaigns. 
Effective interpersonal skills, with sensitivity to different working styles among peers, supervisors and clients
Consistent track record delivering both multi-channel, dynamic campaigns as well as fast-track project-based work.
Commitment to ensuring flawless creative execution within an ever-changing environment via the embodiment and fostering of flexibility, resilience, and a positive outlook.
Innovative mindset, seeking out (and receptive to) feedback.
Initiative and sound judgment balanced with the ability to seek advice of a supervisor or fellow team members when needed.
Demonstrated autonomy over assigned work while striving towards collective team goals.
Excellent time management skills, as well as an understanding of the appropriate time commitments across departments for projects
Ability to inspire, connecting the team to the overall Ogilvy mission and rallying internal and external constituencies as needed.
Experience with Smartsheet or similar PM tools preferred

 
How We’ll Support You
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.
 
 The base salary range for this position at the time of this posting is indicated below. Individual compensation varies based on job-related factors, including location, business needs, level of responsibility, experience, and qualifications. We offer a competitive benefits package, click here for more details.Pay Range$60,000—$140,000 USDAt Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
